title: Split validation runner.py into focused modules
description:
## Problem
\`vibe_quant/validation/runner.py\` is 1,206 lines handling multiple concerns:
- Strategy loading and DSL compilation (~150 lines)
- NautilusTrader engine configuration (~200 lines)
- Data preparation and instrument setup (~150 lines)
- Backtest execution orchestration (~200 lines)
- Result extraction from NT engine (~200 lines)
- Trade record building and P&L calculation (~150 lines)
- SQLite result persistence (~150 lines)

## Solution
Split into focused modules within validation/:

1. **vibe_quant/validation/engine.py** (~250 lines)
   - NT BacktestEngine configuration
   - Venue setup (integrates fill_model.py, latency.py)
   - Data loading into engine
   - Engine lifecycle management

2. **vibe_quant/validation/results.py** (~250 lines)
   - Result extraction from NT engine state
   - TradeRecord building
   - P&L calculation
   - Metric aggregation
   - Result persistence to SQLite

3. **vibe_quant/validation/runner.py** (~300-400 lines remaining)
   - High-level orchestration only
   - Calls: load_strategy() → configure_engine() → run() → extract_results()
   - Public API: run_validation(strategy_id, config) → ValidationResult

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] runner.py reduced from 1,206 to <500 lines
- [ ] engine.py handles all NT BacktestEngine setup
- [ ] results.py handles all post-run extraction and persistence
- [ ] Public API unchanged: run_validation() signature stable
- [ ] All validation tests pass
- [ ] No circular imports between validation submodules

## Files to Modify
- vibe_quant/validation/runner.py (major refactor)
- NEW: vibe_quant/validation/engine.py
- NEW: vibe_quant/validation/results.py

## Phase
Phase 2 - Medium Effort | Parent: vibe-quant-nm8z

title: Add BTC buy-and-hold benchmark overlay on equity curve
description: Professional platforms (QuantConnect, NautilusTrader tearsheets) overlay a benchmark on equity curves. For crypto perp futures, the natural benchmark is BTC buy-and-hold. The strategy must beat simply holding BTC to justify its complexity. Add a benchmark toggle to the equity curve chart that overlays BTC price performance over the same period. Requires loading BTC price data from the ParquetDataCatalog for the backtest period. Files: vibe_quant/dashboard/pages/results_analysis.py (build_equity_curve around line 133, equity chart around line 225).

title: P1: _calculate_sl_price always assumes long in position sizing
description: In dsl/compiler.py:1227, _calculate_sl_price(price, True) always passes is_long=True regardless of actual direction. For short entries the stop distance will be wrong if SL is asymmetric (ATR-based).

title: Add rolling Sharpe ratio chart (60-day window)
description: Rolling Sharpe ratio is essential for detecting regime changes and strategy decay. Add a 60-day rolling window Sharpe chart below the equity curve. NautilusTrader tearsheets already include this. For crypto 24/7 markets, use 365-day annualization factor (not 252). Can be computed from the daily returns series or from trade-level P&L with date bucketing. Files: vibe_quant/dashboard/pages/results_analysis.py.

title: Visual Condition Builder - row-based entry/exit condition builder with dropdowns
description:
Current: Entry/exit conditions are free-form text areas where users type condition strings like 'rsi_14 < 30'. No autocomplete, no syntax highlighting, errors only at save time.

Problem: This is the single biggest UX gap. Users must memorize condition syntax, indicator names, and operators. Typos aren't caught until validation. Composer and 3Commas solve this with visual builders.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Row-based condition builder with 4 columns:
  - Col 1: Left operand dropdown (defined indicators + close/open/high/low)
  - Col 2: Operator dropdown (<, >, <=, >=, crosses_above, crosses_below, between)
  - Col 3: Right operand (number input or indicator dropdown, contextual)
  - Col 4: [+] Add / [-] Remove buttons
- AND logic between conditions (matching current DSL semantics)
- Each row auto-generates the condition string
- 'Advanced: raw condition' toggle per row for free-text edge cases
- Real-time condition validation with green checkmarks per row
- Toggle between visual builder and raw text mode
- Support for 'between' operator (shows two value inputs)
- Separate builder sections for long entry, short entry, long exit, short exit

Files to modify:
- vibe_quant/dashboard/pages/strategy_management.py (replace condition text areas)
- New: vibe_quant/dashboard/components/condition_builder.py
- vibe_quant/dsl/conditions.py (add condition parsing for builder integration)

Priority: P1 (High). Competitive edge over QuantConnect, Backtrader, Zipline (all code-only).

title: Split ethereal execution_client.py and data_client.py
description:
## Problem
- \`vibe_quant/ethereal/execution_client.py\` is 585 lines mixing order building, submission, and state tracking
- \`vibe_quant/ethereal/data_client.py\` is 574 lines mixing REST calls, data parsing, and caching

Both files are close to the 500-line threshold and contain distinct logical units.

## Solution

1. **execution_client.py** (~350 lines remaining)
   - Order submission and lifecycle management
   - Position tracking

2. **vibe_quant/ethereal/order_builder.py** (~200 lines)
   - Order construction helpers
   - Margin/leverage calculations
   - Order parameter validation

3. **data_client.py** (~350 lines remaining)
   - REST API calls and response handling

4. **vibe_quant/ethereal/parsers.py** (~200 lines)
   - Data format parsing (OHLCV, funding, orderbook)
   - Timestamp conversion utilities
   - Common to both clients

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] execution_client.py < 400 lines
- [ ] data_client.py < 400 lines
- [ ] Parsers shared between both clients
- [ ] All ethereal tests pass

## Files to Modify
- vibe_quant/ethereal/execution_client.py
- vibe_quant/ethereal/data_client.py
- NEW: vibe_quant/ethereal/order_builder.py
- NEW: vibe_quant/ethereal/parsers.py

## Phase
Phase 3 - Architectural | Parent: vibe-quant-nm8z

title: Side-by-Side Editor Mode - synchronized YAML + form dual-pane layout
description:
Current: YAML and form modes are mutually exclusive toggle. Unsaved changes lost on switch.

Problem: Users often want to see form summary while editing YAML. Home Assistant learned this and now supports both views simultaneously.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Split-pane layout: YAML editor on left, live form preview on right (or vice versa)
- Changes in either pane sync to the other in real-time (debounced)
- Clicking a form field scrolls YAML editor to that section
- Clicking a YAML section highlights the corresponding form field
- Mobile/narrow viewport: stack vertically with tabs (current behavior as fallback)
- Sync conflict resolution: last-edited pane wins, with visual indicator of which side is 'driving'
- Toggle between: YAML only, Form only, Split view

Files to modify:
- vibe_quant/dashboard/pages/strategy_management.py (editor layout restructure)
- Session state synchronization logic

Priority: P2 (Medium). High effort but unique differentiator - no competitor offers synchronized dual-pane YAML + form editing.

title: ingest_symbol no guard for unsupported symbols
description: Public ingest_symbol() calls create_instrument() which raises KeyError for symbols not in INSTRUMENT_CONFIGS. ingest_all constrains to SUPPORTED_SYMBOLS but direct callers (dashboard, CLI) have no input validation. File: data/ingest.py:336

title: [P1] Background job INSERT OR REPLACE can silently overwrite job records
description: background_jobs has UNIQUE(run_id) and manager uses INSERT OR REPLACE. If a job crashes and is restarted, the old PID/timestamps are silently overwritten, breaking heartbeat logic. Should use explicit upsert or separate insert/update paths.

title: Fix form state loss on YAML/Visual mode switch
description: Currently cleanup_form_state() deletes all form state when switching modes. Instead: sync form→YAML when switching to YAML, and parse YAML→form when switching to Visual. Never lose user work. This is the #1 frustration anti-pattern.

title: P1: Fallback make_qty(1.0) is not equity-relative in position sizing
description: In dsl/compiler.py:1244-1245, when position size calculation fails it falls back to make_qty(1.0). For BTC at $50k that's $50k; for altcoins at $0.001 that's nothing. Fallback should be equity-relative.

title: [P1] Consistency checker queries non-existent strategy_name column
description: consistency.py:126-127,:146-147 SELECT strategy_name FROM sweep_results/backtest_results. schema.py has no strategy_name in those tables. Tests mask this with custom schemas including the column. Runtime will crash with OperationalError. Ref: SPEC.md:1557-1561.

title: SQL injection in DuckDB event log queries
description: All 4 DuckDB query functions in logging/query.py use f-string interpolation for run_id into SQL. Malicious run_id can inject SQL. Lines 60,105,143,188. Fix: validate run_id is alphanumeric before interpolation.

title: Backtest Launch UX Improvements - sticky header, date presets, pre-flight checklist
description:
Current: Backtest launch page is a long vertical scroll. Strategy details collapsed by default. No quick-start flow.

Problem: Users lose context as they scroll. No date presets. No pre-run summary. No visual completion indicators.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Sticky strategy summary header showing selected strategy name, timeframe, indicator count at top
- Collapsible sections with completion indicators (green check when configured)
- 'Quick backtest' mode: pre-fill everything with defaults, one-click to run
- Date range presets: 'Last 30 days', 'Last 90 days', 'Last year', 'Full history', 'Custom'
- Symbol search with volume/market cap hints to help users choose relevant pairs
- Pre-flight checklist dialog before running: strategy, symbols, date range, combinations, filters
- Parameter combination calculator updating in real-time as sweep values change
- Visual indicator of screening vs validation mode differences (side-by-side comparison card)

Files to modify:
- vibe_quant/dashboard/pages/backtest_launch.py (all sections)

Priority: P2 (Medium).

title: Refactor DSL compiler with Jinja2 templates
description:
## Problem
`vibe_quant/dsl/compiler.py` is 1,283 lines of string-concatenation-based code generation. It builds Python source code for NautilusTrader Strategy classes by concatenating strings across many branching paths:
- Import generation
- Config class generation
- Strategy class skeleton
- on_start() method (indicator initialization)
- on_bar() method (signal logic, entry/exit conditions)
- Position sizing integration

String concatenation for code generation is:
- Fragile: indentation errors are hard to spot
- Hard to test: can't test template fragments independently
- Hard to read: mixing Python logic with generated Python code

## Solution
Replace string concatenation with Jinja2 templates:

1. **vibe_quant/dsl/templates/** directory with .j2 files:
   - `strategy.py.j2` - main strategy class template
   - `imports.j2` - import block
   - `config.j2` - config class
   - `on_start.j2` - on_start method body
   - `on_bar.j2` - on_bar method body

2. **vibe_quant/dsl/compiler.py** (~400-500 lines remaining):
   - Template context preparation (converting DSL model to template variables)
   - Template rendering
   - Post-processing (formatting, validation)

3. **vibe_quant/dsl/codegen.py** (~200 lines):
   - Helper functions for template context preparation
   - Indicator configuration builders
   - Condition expression builders

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] compiler.py reduced from 1,283 to <500 lines
- [ ] Jinja2 templates created for all code generation sections
- [ ] Generated strategy code is identical (diff test against current output)
- [ ] All existing DSL compilation tests pass
- [ ] Template fragments are independently testable
- [ ] jinja2 added to pyproject.toml dependencies

## Files to Modify
- vibe_quant/dsl/compiler.py (major refactor)
- NEW: vibe_quant/dsl/templates/*.j2
- NEW: vibe_quant/dsl/codegen.py (template context helpers)
- pyproject.toml (add jinja2 dependency)

## Phase
Phase 2 - Medium Effort | Parent: vibe-quant-nm8z

title: Refactor StateManager into specialized store classes
description:
## Problem
\`vibe_quant/db/state_manager.py\` is 649 lines acting as a god object with 15+ public methods spanning 5+ database tables:
- Strategy CRUD (save, load, list, delete strategies)
- Backtest run management (create, update, list runs)
- Sweep result storage (save, query, filter results)
- Configuration persistence (save/load settings)
- Metric queries (aggregate stats, comparisons)

This violates single responsibility and makes the class hard to test and extend.

## Solution
Split into specialized stores with a facade:

1. **vibe_quant/db/strategy_store.py** (~150 lines)
   - save_strategy(), load_strategy(), list_strategies(), delete_strategy()
   - Strategy search and filtering

2. **vibe_quant/db/backtest_store.py** (~200 lines)
   - create_run(), update_run(), get_run(), list_runs()
   - save_results(), get_results(), query_results()
   - Sweep result management

3. **vibe_quant/db/config_store.py** (~100 lines)
   - save_config(), load_config()
   - Settings persistence

4. **vibe_quant/db/state_manager.py** (~150 lines remaining - facade)
   - Composes all stores
   - Delegates to specialized stores
   - Maintains backward-compatible API
   - Connection management

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] StateManager reduced from 649 to <200 lines (facade only)
- [ ] Each store is independently testable
- [ ] Backward-compatible: existing code using StateManager still works
- [ ] Each store manages its own table(s)
- [ ] All database tests pass
- [ ] WAL mode still enabled on every connection

## Files to Modify
- vibe_quant/db/state_manager.py (major refactor to facade)
- NEW: vibe_quant/db/strategy_store.py
- NEW: vibe_quant/db/backtest_store.py
- NEW: vibe_quant/db/config_store.py

## Phase
Phase 3 - Architectural | Parent: vibe-quant-nm8z

title: Discovery: SL/TP 100x scale mismatch between genome.py and operators.py
description: genome.py SL range 0.01-0.15 (fraction), operators.py SL range 0.5-10.0 (percentage). Cross-module conversion via sl_pct*100 produces 500% SL. Fix: unify representation. See reviews/discovery.md C-4.

title: Phase 3: Validation Backtesting & Risk
description: Run full-fidelity NautilusTrader backtests with custom fills, latency simulation, position sizing, and risk management.
close_reason: All Phase 3 tasks complete: validation venue, position sizing, risk management, event logging, validation runner, consistency checker

title: Strategies: load_dict() has no error handling
description: _metadata.py:34-36 yaml.safe_load(self.path.read_text()) with no try/except. Crashes on missing file or malformed YAML. Fix: validate path.exists(), catch yaml.YAMLError, return meaningful error. See reviews/strategies.md H-2

title: Add real-time YAML validation with debouncing
description: Currently validation only runs on Save click. Add debounced (500ms) validation that runs as user types. Show error count badge, highlight line numbers with errors, show inline error messages in the preview panel. Critical for power users editing YAML.

title: Improve equity curve to use daily returns series
description: The current build_equity_curve() builds equity from trade close events only, producing a stepped curve that misses intra-trade equity changes entirely. Professional platforms show continuous equity curves from daily mark-to-market returns. Short-term fix: use both entry and exit timestamps. Long-term: persist a daily returns series from NT PortfolioAnalyzer during the backtest run. This enables continuous equity curves, accurate rolling Sharpe, and proper drawdown analysis. Files: vibe_quant/dashboard/pages/results_analysis.py (build_equity_curve line 133), vibe_quant/validation/runner.py.

title: Feature parity audit: checklist verification, side-by-side screenshots
Surface stored but hidden metrics in results dashboard
description: The DB schema stores avg_win, avg_loss, largest_win, largest_loss, max_consecutive_wins, max_consecutive_losses, winning_trades, losing_trades, and execution_time_seconds — but these are NOT displayed in the metrics panel on the results analysis page. Add st.metric calls or a dedicated section to show all these stored values. Also compute and show derived metrics: Expectancy = (win_rate * avg_win) + ((1 - win_rate) * avg_loss), Payoff Ratio = abs(avg_win / avg_loss), Cost Drag % = (total_fees + total_funding + total_slippage) / gross_pnl * 100. Files: vibe_quant/dashboard/pages/results_analysis.py (render_metrics_panel around line 264).

title: Split risk actors.py into strategy and portfolio actors
description:
## Problem
\`vibe_quant/risk/actors.py\` is 726 lines containing two distinct NautilusTrader Actor classes plus shared event logging:
- StrategyRiskActor (~300 lines): strategy-level risk (drawdown, daily loss, consecutive losses, circuit breakers)
- PortfolioRiskActor (~250 lines): portfolio-level aggregate risk monitoring
- Shared risk event logging and state tracking (~150 lines)

Having both actors in one file makes it harder to maintain and test independently.

## Solution
Split into:

1. **vibe_quant/risk/strategy_actor.py** (~300 lines)
   - StrategyRiskActor class
   - Strategy-level risk checks
   - Circuit breaker logic

2. **vibe_quant/risk/portfolio_actor.py** (~250 lines)
   - PortfolioRiskActor class
   - Aggregate risk monitoring
   - Cross-strategy correlation checks

3. **vibe_quant/risk/events.py** (~100 lines)
   - RiskEvent dataclass
   - Risk event types enum
   - Event formatting utilities

4. **vibe_quant/risk/actors.py** (backward-compat re-exports)
   - Re-export both actors for existing importers
   - Deprecation notice

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Each actor in its own file, <400 lines
- [ ] Risk events extracted to shared module
- [ ] Backward-compatible imports via actors.py re-exports
- [ ] All risk tests pass
- [ ] No circular imports

## Files to Modify

- NEW: vibe_quant/risk/events.py

Dashboard Discovery: Start Discovery launches non-executable module (missing discovery __main__)
description:
## Summary
Starting Discovery from the dashboard creates a job row and shows RUNNING in UI, but the worker process exits immediately because the launch target is not executable.

## Reproduction
1. Start dashboard:
   uv run --extra dev streamlit run vibe_quant/dashboard/app.py --server.port 8501
2. Open Discovery page.
3. Click Start Discovery.
4. Observe UI shows an active job with PID.
5. Check logs/discovery_latest.log.

## Expected
Discovery worker starts and processes generations.

## Actual
Worker exits immediately with module entrypoint error.

## Evidence
- Log: logs/discovery_latest.log
  - No module named vibe_quant.discovery.__main__; 'vibe_quant.discovery' is a package and cannot be directly executed
- UI screenshots:
  - verification-ui-discovery-after-start.png
  - verification-ui-discovery-kill-after-zombie.png
- Report:
  - verification-unfixed-ui-round2-2026-02-13.md

## Impact
Discovery is non-functional via UI. Users can launch jobs that will never produce results.
close_reason: Implemented and verified discovery CLI entrypoint. Added vibe_quant/discovery/__main__.py, updated dashboard discovery launch command to pass run-id, and validated with unit tests + CLI smoke run.

title: Anti-Overfitting UX Integration - risk indicators, educational tooltips, results comparison
description:
Current: Three checkboxes for overfitting filters (DSR, WFA, Purged K-Fold) with tooltips but no further context.

Problem: Research shows 100% performance gap between in-sample and out-of-sample. Users need to understand overfitting risk, not just toggle checkboxes.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Always-visible overfitting risk indicator based on:
  - Number of parameter combinations tested
  - Ratio of in-sample to out-of-sample data
  - Strategy complexity (number of conditions and indicators)
- Overfitting risk score: Low/Medium/High with color coding
- Educational tooltips explaining each filter with visual diagrams (DSR formula, WFA methodology, K-Fold diagram)
- 'Why this matters' expandable section with statistical context
- Automatic warning messages: 'You tested N combinations on M months of data. There is X% chance of finding a false positive'
- After backtest: show in-sample vs out-of-sample metrics side by side
- Deflated Sharpe Ratio shown alongside regular Sharpe
- Visual comparison chart: backfitted performance vs walk-forward performance

Files to modify:
- vibe_quant/dashboard/pages/backtest_launch.py (overfitting filter section)
- vibe_quant/dashboard/pages/results_analysis.py (results comparison)
- New: vibe_quant/dashboard/components/overfitting_indicators.py

Priority: P2 (Medium). Unique differentiator - no competitor builds overfitting awareness into the UX.

title: Implement Deflated Sharpe Ratio (DSR)
description: Bailey & Lopez de Prado DSR formula. Input: observed Sharpe, N trials, skewness, kurtosis. Output: p-value (confidence Sharpe not a fluke). Filter threshold: DSR > 0.95.

title: Implement Walk-Forward Analysis (WFA)
description: Configurable window generator (9m train / 3m test / 1m step). Run NT screening-mode on train, validate on test. Compute WF efficiency: mean(OOS_return)/mean(IS_return). Filter: efficiency > 0.5, >50% OOS windows profitable. ~12 windows from 2 years data.

title: Implement Purged K-Fold Cross-Validation
description: K-fold time-series splitter with purge gap. Auto-detect purge size from indicator lookback. Compute OOS metrics per fold. Filter: mean OOS Sharpe > 0.5, std < 1.0.

title: Backtest Launch: No validation that selected dates have data in catalog
Extract abstract data archive to deduplicate Binance/Ethereal ingestion
description:
## Problem
Two parallel data ingestion systems share ~70% common logic:
- \`vibe_quant/data/ingest.py\` (899 lines) - Binance kline + funding ingestion
- \`vibe_quant/ethereal/ingestion.py\` (943 lines) - Ethereal DEX data ingestion

Common patterns duplicated in both:
- SQLite archive creation and management (WAL mode, schema, upserts)
- Timestamp handling and gap detection
- Incremental download orchestration (check last archived → download delta)
- Archive → ParquetDataCatalog transformation
- Funding rate download and storage
- Progress reporting and error handling

Total: ~1,840 lines with ~1,200 lines of duplicated logic.

## Solution
Extract a shared base:

1. **vibe_quant/data/base_archive.py** (~300 lines)
   - Abstract class \`DataArchive\`:
     - \`create_schema()\` - abstract
     - \`get_last_timestamp(symbol)\` - shared
     - \`upsert_bars(symbol, bars)\` - shared  
     - \`archive_to_catalog(symbol, timeframes)\` - shared
     - \`get_coverage(symbol)\` - shared
   - Common timestamp utilities
   - SQLite connection management (WAL mode)

2. **vibe_quant/data/base_ingestor.py** (~200 lines)
   - Abstract class \`DataIngestor\`:
     - \`download_bars(symbol, start, end)\` - abstract (API-specific)
     - \`download_funding(symbol, start, end)\` - abstract
     - \`ingest_symbol(symbol, years)\` - shared orchestration
     - \`ingest_all(symbols, years)\` - shared parallel orchestration
     - \`update_symbol(symbol)\` - shared incremental logic

title: Screening: ProcessPoolExecutor serialization failure risk
description: pipeline.py:207-212 passes _runner as closure to ProcessPoolExecutor. NTScreeningRunner with Path objects and cached state may fail to pickle. Fix: convert Path to str, ensure picklable state. See reviews/screening.md H-2
close_reason: ProcessPoolExecutor serialization is standard Python multiprocessing. If objects aren't picklable, you get a clear runtime error. Not a latent bug.

title: Enhanced YAML Editor - replace text_area with Monaco editor + real-time validation
description:
Current: Plain st.text_area with no syntax highlighting, no autocompletion, no inline error markers. 500px fixed height.

Problem: Streamlit's text_area is the wrong component for code editing. Leading platforms use Monaco or CodeMirror 6 with schema-based validation, hover docs, and code folding.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Replace st.text_area with streamlit-monaco or streamlit-code-editor component
- YAML syntax highlighting with proper color scheme
- Schema-based autocompletion for indicator types, timeframes, operators, sources
- Inline error markers (red squiggly underlines) on validation errors
- Hover documentation showing field descriptions from Pydantic model docstrings
- Code folding for indicators, conditions, time_filters sections
- Line numbers
- Real-time validation (debounced 500ms) showing errors inline, not just on button click
- Side panel showing parsed strategy summary (indicators, conditions, risk params) updating live
- Snippet insertion buttons for common patterns (add indicator, add condition, add session)

Files to modify:
- vibe_quant/dashboard/pages/strategy_management.py (replace YAML editor)
- pyproject.toml (add streamlit-monaco or streamlit-code-editor dependency)
- New: vibe_quant/dashboard/components/yaml_editor.py (editor wrapper with validation)
- vibe_quant/dsl/schema.py (export JSON Schema for editor autocomplete)

Priority: P1 (High). Competitive edge over TradingView Pine Editor (no YAML schema support), NinjaTrader (C# editor).

title: Backtest Launch shows transient run-status desync (Active Jobs vs Recent Runs)
description:
## Summary
Backtest Launch page can show inconsistent status between Active Jobs and Recent Runs after worker exit.

## Reproduction
1. Launch screening or validation run from Backtest Launch.
2. Wait for subprocess to exit quickly (failed case).
3. Observe Active Jobs and Recent Runs sections.

## Expected
Both sections reflect the same terminal status immediately (failed/completed).

## Actual
Active Jobs can become empty while Recent Runs still displays running for the same run until navigation/rerender.

## Evidence
- Observed for run #4 and #5 during UI verification session.
- DB already showed failed status while Recent Runs still showed running.
- Status corrected after page navigation round-trip.
- Report:
  - verification-unfixed-ui-round2-2026-02-13.md

## Impact
Operators can misread run state during incident/debug workflows.

title: Add/Remove Indicator Flow - enable full indicator CRUD in form editor
description:
Current: Form editor renders existing indicators as expanders but has NO way to add new indicators or remove existing ones. Users must switch to YAML mode.

Problem: This is a critical gap that forces users out of form mode for common operations. Every form-based editor should support full CRUD.

Acceptance Criteria:
- '+ Add Indicator' button below the indicator list
  - Opens indicator catalog (see indicator catalog issue)
  - Generates unique name suggestion (e.g., rsi_14, ema_50)
  - Adds a new expander with selected indicator type pre-configured
- 'Remove' button (with confirmation) on each indicator expander
- 'Duplicate' button to copy an indicator with a new name (useful for sweep variations)
- Drag-and-drop reordering of indicators (cosmetic, improves scanability)
- Indicator dependency visualization: show which conditions reference which indicators
- Highlight orphan indicators (defined but not used in any condition)
- Warn when removing an indicator that is referenced by conditions or stop_loss/take_profit

Files to modify:
- vibe_quant/dashboard/pages/strategy_management.py (_render_form_editor function)
- Session state management for dynamic indicator list

Priority: P1 (High). Low effort, high impact fix for form editor completeness.

title: NT BacktestNode InvalidStateTrigger RUNNING->DISPOSE on dispose
Strategy Validation Summary Panel - pre-backtest health check with warnings
description:
Current: Validation is binary (success/error). No summary of what was validated, no warnings for suboptimal configurations.

Problem: Users don't know if their strategy is good, only if it's syntactically valid. MT5 and NinjaTrader provide optimization hints.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Validation summary card after successful validation showing:
  - Number of indicators, conditions, sweep params
  - Risk/reward ratio calculation
  - Estimated backtest combinations
  - Strategy complexity score (simple/moderate/complex)
- Smart warnings for common issues:
  - 'No exit conditions defined for short' (partial coverage)
  - 'Sweep has >5000 combinations' (may be slow)
  - 'No time filters configured' (trades 24/7 including weekends)
  - 'Stop loss > 5%' (high risk per trade)
  - 'Only 1 entry condition' (potentially noisy signals)
  - 'Indicator defined but not used in any condition' (orphan)
  - 'No ATR indicator defined but using ATR-based stop loss'
- 'Ready to backtest' checklist showing configured vs missing components
- Severity levels: info, warning, error

Files to modify:
- vibe_quant/dashboard/pages/strategy_management.py (add summary after validation)
- New: vibe_quant/dashboard/components/validation_summary.py
- vibe_quant/dsl/parser.py (add warning-level checks alongside validation)

Priority: P2 (Medium). Low effort, unique feature no competitor offers.

title: Elevate time filters with visual weekly calendar and funding overlay
description: Move time filters from section 5 to section 2 (after indicators). Add visual 7x24 weekly grid showing allowed/blocked hours. Add session presets (Asia 01-09 UTC, London 07-16, US 13-22, 24/7). Show 8h funding schedule overlay. For crypto perpetuals, this is critical UX.

title: Results & analytics router (/api/results)
Alerts: MEDIUM+LOW code quality (3M + 3L findings)
description: M-1: no retry logic for transient HTTP failures, critical alerts permanently lost (telegram.py:246-256). M-2: DailySummary format_message uses .2f on Decimal without quantize(). M-3: send_trade doesnt validate price/quantity > 0. L-1: alert failures swallowed into boolean False, no observability. L-2: _get_client silently recreates closed client. L-3: circuit_breaker concatenates reason+details without separator. See reviews/alerts.md
close_reason: P2 code quality: bulk tasks with small findings. Individual actionable items should be separate bugs.

title: [P3] _perturb(0.0) makes genetic mutation stuck at zero for thresholds
description: operators.py:_perturb() returns 0.0 unchanged when value==0.0 because delta=value*frac=0. Gene thresholds starting at 0 can never mutate away from zero through perturbation alone (only structural mutation replaces the gene entirely). Pre-existing behavior, not introduced by optimization. Low impact: thresholds are initialized random in [0,100] so rarely hit 0.

title: [P3] Consider Cython/C extension for Pareto front if population sizes exceed 2000
description: Benchmarks show pure Python with inlined comparisons beats NumPy for n<2000 (3-4x faster). But for n>2000 the O(n^2) Python loop becomes the bottleneck. If screening/GA population sizes grow beyond ~2000, consider a Cython extension for compute_pareto_front() and pareto_rank(). Current typical sizes: screening 50-500, GA 50.

title: [P3] Purged K-Fold variance uses computational formula - potential numerical instability for extreme values
description: purged_kfold.py:_aggregate_results uses Var=(sum_x2 - n*mean^2)/(n-1) which can suffer catastrophic cancellation when values are large and similar. For typical Sharpe ratios (-1 to 4) this is fine. If ever applied to larger-magnitude values, consider switching to true Welford online algorithm. Guard against negative variance from float rounding is already in place.

title: [P3] DSR lru_cache on _expected_max_sharpe persists for process lifetime
description: dsr.py:DeflatedSharpeRatio._expected_max_sharpe has @lru_cache(maxsize=1024). Since num_trials is typically a small set of integers (e.g. 100, 200, 500), the cache is very effective but entries are never evicted until process exit. For long-running services, memory is bounded by maxsize=1024 entries (~8KB), which is negligible. No action needed unless maxsize is increased significantly.

description:
## Problem
`vibe_quant/dashboard/pages/results_analysis.py` is 1,529 lines — the largest file in the codebase. It mixes:
- Data loading and caching (~200 lines)
- Plotly chart generation (~600 lines): equity curves, drawdown charts, 3D Pareto scatter, trade scatter, radar charts
- Metric calculations and formatting (~200 lines)
- Streamlit UI layout and widgets (~500 lines)

This makes it hard to test, maintain, or reuse chart components.

## Solution
Extract into focused modules:

1. **vibe_quant/dashboard/charts.py** (~500-600 lines)
   - All Plotly figure builders: equity_chart(), drawdown_chart(), pareto_scatter_3d(), trade_scatter(), radar_chart(), etc.
   - Pure functions: take data in, return go.Figure out
   - Reusable by other dashboard pages

2. **vibe_quant/dashboard/data_builders.py** (~200 lines)
   - Cached data loading functions
   - Result aggregation and filtering logic
   - Metric computation helpers

3. **vibe_quant/dashboard/pages/results_analysis.py** (~400-500 lines remaining)
   - Only Streamlit UI layout
   - Imports charts and data builders
   - Widget definitions and page structure

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] results_analysis.py reduced to <500 lines (UI layout only)
- [ ] charts.py contains all Plotly figure builders as pure functions
- [ ] data_builders.py contains cached data loading
- [ ] Charts are importable/reusable from other pages
- [ ] Dashboard still renders identically
- [ ] ~700 lines net moved out, improving modularity

- NEW: vibe_quant/dashboard/data_builders.py

title: Extract reusable ParameterGrid from screening for discovery module
description:
## Problem
Both the screening pipeline and discovery module need to expand parameter ranges into concrete combinations:
- \`screening/pipeline.py\` builds parameter grids from DSL parameter ranges for exhaustive sweep
- \`discovery/genome.py\` generates random parameter combinations for genetic population initialization
- \`discovery/operators.py\` mutates parameters within defined ranges

The parameter grid logic in screening is tightly coupled to the pipeline and cannot be reused.

## Solution
Extract a shared \`ParameterGrid\` utility:

1. **vibe_quant/utils/param_grid.py** (~150 lines)
   - \`ParameterGrid\` class:
     - \`from_dsl_ranges(ranges: dict)\` - build from DSL parameter definitions
     - \`expand_all()\` → list of all combinations (for screening)
     - \`sample(n)\` → random sample of n combinations (for discovery init)
     - \`count()\` → total combination count
     - \`validate(params)\` → check params within bounds
     - \`clamp(params)\` → clamp values to valid ranges (for mutation)

2. Update screening/pipeline.py to use ParameterGrid
3. Update discovery/genome.py to use ParameterGrid.sample() for initialization
4. Update discovery/operators.py to use ParameterGrid.clamp() for mutation bounds

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] ParameterGrid extracted as reusable utility
- [ ] Screening uses ParameterGrid.expand_all()
- [ ] Discovery uses ParameterGrid.sample() and .clamp()
- [ ] ~100 lines net reduction
- [ ] Both screening and discovery tests pass

## Files to Modify
- NEW: vibe_quant/utils/param_grid.py
- vibe_quant/screening/pipeline.py
- vibe_quant/discovery/genome.py
- vibe_quant/discovery/operators.py

## Phase
Phase 3 - Architectural | Parent: vibe-quant-nm8z

title: Backtest screening job launch passes malformed CLI args and fails immediately
description:
## Summary
Backtest Launch -> Run Screening starts a background job, but the spawned screening command receives malformed arguments and exits immediately.

## Reproduction
1. Open Backtest Launch page.
2. Keep latency preset as None (screening mode).
3. Click Run Screening.
4. Inspect logs/backtest_<run_id>.log for the launched run.

## Expected
Screening worker starts and runs parameter sweep.

## Actual
CLI exits with argument parser error.

## Evidence
- Log: logs/backtest_4.log
  - vibe-quant screening: error: argument subcommand: invalid choice: '4' (choose from run, list, status)
- DB: data/state/vibe_quant.db
  - backtest_runs.id=4, run_mode=screening, status=failed, error_message=Process terminated unexpectedly
- UI screenshots:
  - verification-ui-backtest-after-run-screening.png
  - verification-ui-results-run4-failed.png

## Impact
Screening mode is broken through the main UI path.
close_reason: Fixed screening launch command composition to include required 'run' subcommand. Verified parser/runtime via CLI smoke and tests.

title: Ethereal: HTTP errors silently swallowed during data download
description: ingestion.py:156-160,221-224 non-404 errors (429, 500) silently skipped creating data gaps. Fix: log errors, add retry logic, validate bar counts. See reviews/ethereal.md H-4

title: FastAPI app factory, lifespan, CORS, dependency injection
Fix form_state: falsy-value filtering drops 0.0 values
[P0] Venue config reject_stop_orders=True blocks all stop-loss orders
description: venue.py sets reject_stop_orders=True, causing NautilusTrader to reject all stop orders. SPEC Section 7: 'Stop Loss: Stop-market orders (triggered at mark price, filled with slippage).' Stop-loss is a core risk feature and is completely broken. Fix: set reject_stop_orders=False.

title: [P0] DSL compiler generates no SL/TP orders despite DSL config
description: compiler.py generates strategies that only submit market orders for entry/exit. Despite DSL supporting stop_loss (atr_fixed, atr_trailing, fixed_pct) and take_profit config, the compiler ignores these entirely. Generated strategies rely solely on signal-based exits. No automatic stop-loss protection. SPEC Section 7 requires 'Entry: Market orders, Stop Loss: Stop-market orders, Take Profit: Limit orders.'

title: [P0] VolumeSlippageFillModel is dead code - custom slippage has zero effect
description: fill_model.py VolumeSlippageFillModel subclasses FillModel and adds calculate_slippage_factor() method, but this method is never called by NautilusTrader. NT's FillModel base class has specific internal methods (is_limit_filled, is_stop_filled) that control fill behavior. Since none are overridden, all backtests use base FillModel regardless of config. Also the formula misses spread/2 + volatility terms from SPEC.

title: [P1] Position sizing hardcoded to Quantity(1.0) - sizing modules not integrated
description: compiler.py _calculate_position_size() always returns Quantity(1.0). Position sizing modules (FixedFractional, Kelly, ATR) exist in risk/sizing.py but are never integrated into compiled strategies or the validation runner. Every trade is 1.0 unit regardless of account balance or risk config. Exit orders also use 1.0 instead of actual position size.

title: [P1] Position tracking uses booleans instead of NT event system
description: compiler.py generated strategies set self._position_open=True immediately after submitting orders, before fill confirmation. If order is rejected by risk engine, strategy believes it has an open position when it doesn't. No on_event() handler to track actual order/position events. Should use NT's position tracking.

title: [P1] No funding rate subscription in compiled strategies or validation runner
description: SPEC Section 7 says validation must 'Subscribe to FundingRateUpdate data.' Neither compiled strategies nor the runner sets up funding rate subscriptions. Funding costs are not modeled in backtests despite being a major cost for perpetual futures.

title: [P1] Validation runner missing SPEC metrics (CAGR, Calmar, volatility, trade stats)
description: ValidationResult and _extract_stats don't populate many SPEC-required metrics: cagr, calmar_ratio, volatility_annual, max_drawdown_duration_days, avg_trade_duration_hours, max_consecutive_wins/losses, largest_win/loss, avg_win/loss. Exit reasons are hardcoded to 'signal' instead of tracking SL/TP/liquidation.

title: [P1] Compiler generates duplicate threshold parameter names
description: compiler.py condition thresholds use names like {indicator}_threshold. Two conditions on same indicator (e.g., 'rsi < 30' and 'rsi > 70') both generate rsi_threshold - second overwrites first. Also: negative numbers not supported in condition parser (regex uses \w+ which doesn't match leading minus).

title: [P1] Session filter fails for overnight sessions crossing midnight
description: compiler.py generates session_start <= local_time <= session_end. A session like {start: '22:00', end: '06:00'} never matches because 22:00 <= t AND t <= 06:00 is always False. Need OR logic for overnight sessions.

title: Latency naming inconsistency: colocated vs co_located in code vs SPEC
[P1] WFA robustness check missing efficiency criterion from SPEC
description: wfa.py is_robust checks aggregated_oos_sharpe, avg_degradation, consistency - but NOT walk-forward efficiency. SPEC Section 8: 'Walk-forward efficiency > 0.5 AND > 50% of OOS windows profitable.' Efficiency is computed but never checked in the robustness determination.

title: [P1] Purged K-Fold uses fixed percentage purge instead of indicator lookback
description: purged_kfold.py uses purge_pct=0.01 (1% of total samples). SPEC Section 8: 'Purge period: Max indicator lookback (e.g., 50 bars for EMA-50).' Should auto-detect from strategy's indicator lookback windows. Also robustness criteria differ from SPEC (combined mean-std vs separate mean>0.5 AND std<1.0).

title: [P2] DSR called with default moments (skewness=0, kurtosis=3) ignoring actual distribution
description: overfitting/pipeline.py calls DSR with default skewness=0.0 and kurtosis=3.0 (normal distribution). Actual return distribution moments are never computed from backtest results. This reduces DSR to a simple Sharpe significance test, losing the non-normality correction that is DSR's key value.

title: [P2] Latency preset values are half of SPEC values
description: latency.py all presets are exactly half SPEC values (co-located 0.5ms vs 1ms, retail 100ms vs 200ms). Comment says 'NT adds operation latencies internally' but this assumption needs verification. If incorrect, all backtests run optimistically biased.

title: [P0] st.set_page_config called after st.navigation - dashboard crashes on load
description: app.py calls st.navigation() before st.set_page_config(). Streamlit requires set_page_config to be the FIRST Streamlit command. This raises StreamlitAPIException at runtime, preventing the dashboard from loading.

title: [P1] width='stretch' used 20+ times instead of use_container_width=True
description: Every st.dataframe() and st.plotly_chart() across all dashboard pages uses width='stretch' which is NOT a valid Streamlit parameter. Correct parameter is use_container_width=True. All charts and tables render at narrow default width instead of full container width, making the dashboard look unprofessional. Affected: discovery.py, results_analysis.py, data_management.py, settings.py.

title: [P1] No auto-refresh for active jobs or paper trading - manual clicks required
description: SPEC requires 'Streamlit polls SQLite every 2 seconds for status updates.' No page implements any auto-refresh. Active job statuses, paper trading positions, and discovery progress only update on manual interaction. For a trading dashboard, this is a critical UX gap.

title: [P1] Results analysis missing monthly returns heatmap and trade distribution histogram
description: SPEC Phase 5 requires 'Monthly returns heatmap (Plotly heatmap)' and 'Trade distribution histogram.' Both are completely absent from results_analysis.py. These are standard backtest analysis visualizations.

title: [P1] Sweep result detail view has no equity curve, drawdown chart, or trade log
description: When selecting an individual sweep result in results_analysis.py, only parameters and overfitting badges are shown. SPEC requires equity curve, drawdown chart, trade log, metrics panel, and cost breakdown for individual results. No click-through from scatter plot or table to detail.

title: [P1] Data ingestion blocks Streamlit UI thread
description: data_management.py _run_ingest/_run_update/_run_rebuild synchronously iterate over subprocess stdout in the Streamlit thread. UI is completely frozen during downloads. If download takes long, Streamlit timeout kills the connection. Should run as background job like backtests.

title: Overlay equity curves in comparison view
description: The current comparison view (render_comparison_view) shows a simple metrics table. Enhance with: (1) Overlaid equity curves — plot 2-3 equity curves on the same chart with shared x-axis and different colors. (2) Overlaid drawdown curves — same treatment. This makes visual comparison of strategy performance much more intuitive than numbers alone. Files: vibe_quant/dashboard/pages/results_analysis.py (render_comparison_view around line 342).

title: [P1] Settings page missing CRUD for sizing/risk configs (only Create exists)
description: SPEC requires 'Sizing module CRUD' and 'Risk module CRUD' but settings.py only has Create forms. No Edit or Delete functionality. Also missing: overfitting filter default configuration, Telegram bot token configuration.

title: [P2] Strategy form editor cannot add/remove indicators or configure allowed sessions
description: strategy_management.py form editor iterates existing indicators but has no way to add new or remove existing ones. Allowed sessions (allowed_sessions) configuration is completely missing from the UI despite DSL support. Form/YAML mode switch doesn't sync changes.

title: [P2] Discovery export-to-strategy is dead end
description: discovery.py 'Export to Strategy' button sets session_state[f'exported_dsl_{i}'] but strategy_management.py never reads this key. Export succeeds in UI but nothing happens. Hardcoded symbol list, no auto-refresh for running jobs, no live progress visualization as required by SPEC Phase 8.

title: [P2] Drawdown calculation starts at equity=0 instead of starting capital
description: results_analysis.py build_equity_curve starts with equity=0.0 then adds PnL. When first trade is a loss, drawdown should be computed from starting capital, not from 0. Also drawdown=0 when peak=0, which is incorrect for initial losing trades.

title: [P2] Paper trading delta_color='inverse' shows losses in green
description: paper_trading.py uses delta_color='inverse' when total_pnl < 0, which swaps Streamlit's color convention (red->green, green->red). A negative P&L delta renders green. For a financial dashboard, this is misleading and unprofessional.

title: [P1] Position sizing hardcoded to 1.0 in compiled strategies
description: compiler.py _calculate_position_size() always returns instrument.make_qty(1.0). SPEC Section 9 requires pluggable position sizing modules (Kelly, Fixed Fractional, ATR-based). The compiled strategy config has no sizing_module field and no integration point for the PositionSizer interface. All backtests run with unit quantity regardless of account equity or risk parameters.

title: [P2] DSR in overfitting pipeline always uses normal distribution defaults
description: overfitting/pipeline.py:307-308 reads candidate.get('skewness', 0.0) and candidate.get('kurtosis', 3.0) but the SQL query in _load_candidates() does not select these columns. The sweep_results schema has no skewness/kurtosis columns. DSR always falls back to skewness=0.0, kurtosis=3.0 (normal distribution), which makes the non-normality correction ineffective for fat-tailed crypto returns.

title: Strategy CRUD router (GET/POST/PUT/DELETE /api/strategies)
Data: type error in _print_summary when archive path is None
description: ingest.py:509 passes Path|None to function expecting Path. Line 571 calls .stat() on None. Fix: use archive._db_path or DEFAULT_ARCHIVE_PATH. See reviews/data.md H-2

title: Add long vs short performance split analysis
description: For crypto perp futures at 20x leverage, long and short performance can diverge dramatically. Add a long/short breakdown table or grouped bar chart showing: win rate, profit factor, avg win/loss, trade count, total PnL, and avg holding time split by direction. Trade data already has the direction field. Critical for understanding strategy behavior in trending vs ranging markets. Files: vibe_quant/dashboard/pages/results_analysis.py.

title: Alerts: rate limit uses monotonic clock, wrong after sleep
description: telegram.py:181-195 time.monotonic() behavior varies during system sleep. On wake, rate limits expire instantly causing alert storms. Fix: use time.time() for real-world interval. See reviews/alerts.md H-2
close_reason: time.monotonic() is correct for rate limiting. On macOS it excludes sleep time making rate limits MORE conservative (not less) during sleep. Using time.time() would be worse as NTP adjustments can cause clock jumps. The claimed 'alert storm' behavior is inverted.

title: atr_trailing stop loss is NOT trailing (identical to atr_fixed)
description: atr_trailing and atr_fixed generate identical code in _calculate_sl_price. No on_bar logic updates the SL order as price advances. 3/5 DB strategies use atr_trailing and get a fixed stop instead. File: dsl/templates.py:147-153

title: CLI: accept precise date range for data ingestion (not just --years)
description: Refactor data ingest CLI to accept --start and --end dates (YYYY-MM-DD) instead of only --years. get_years_months_to_download should accept start/end datetimes. Also support partial months via REST API for the current incomplete month. The download_data script currently only supports --years N which rounds to full months.

Split screening pipeline.py into focused modules
description:
## Problem
\`vibe_quant/screening/pipeline.py\` is 845 lines mixing multiple concerns:
- Parameter grid generation and expansion (~100 lines)
- Multiprocessing orchestration with ProcessPoolExecutor (~150 lines)
- Individual backtest execution (simplified NT mode) (~200 lines)
- Multi-metric filtering (hard cutoffs for Sharpe, max DD, etc.) (~100 lines)
- Pareto front computation (~100 lines)
- Result ranking and selection (~100 lines)
- SQLite persistence (~100 lines)

## Solution
Split into focused modules:

1. **vibe_quant/screening/grid.py** (~150 lines)
   - ParameterGrid class
   - Grid expansion from DSL parameter ranges
   - Combination counting and validation

2. **vibe_quant/screening/executor.py** (~250 lines)
   - Parallel backtest execution
   - ProcessPoolExecutor management
   - Worker function for single backtest run
   - Progress reporting

3. **vibe_quant/screening/ranking.py** (~200 lines)
   - Hard filters (minimum Sharpe, max drawdown cap, etc.)
   - Pareto front computation
   - Multi-metric ranking
   - Result selection

4. **vibe_quant/screening/pipeline.py** (~250 lines remaining)
   - High-level orchestration
   - Calls: expand_grid() → execute_parallel() → filter_and_rank() → persist()
   - Public API: run_screening(strategy_dsl, config) → list[ScreeningResult]

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] pipeline.py reduced from 845 to <300 lines
- [ ] grid.py handles parameter expansion (reusable by discovery module)
- [ ] executor.py handles parallel execution
- [ ] ranking.py handles filtering and Pareto computation
- [ ] Public API unchanged
- [ ] All screening tests pass

## Files to Modify
- vibe_quant/screening/pipeline.py (major refactor)
- NEW: vibe_quant/screening/grid.py
- NEW: vibe_quant/screening/executor.py
- NEW: vibe_quant/screening/ranking.py

## Phase
Phase 2 - Medium Effort | Parent: vibe-quant-nm8z

[UI/UX] Add professional dark theme with trading-optimized color palette
description:
Current theme uses basic dark Streamlit defaults (#0E1117 bg, #2962FF primary). Research shows trading dashboards benefit from a refined palette:

**Changes:**
1. Update `.streamlit/config.toml` with separate `[theme.dark]` and `[theme.light]` tables
2. Use muted profit/loss colors: green (#26A69A) for gains, red (#EF5350) for losses — matching TradingView conventions
3. Primary accent: professional blue (#2962FF is OK, keep it)
4. Secondary bg: slightly warmer dark (#1C1E26) for better card separation
5. Add `theme.chartSequentialColors` and `theme.chartCategoricalColors` for consistent Plotly/Altair chart palettes
6. Configure sidebar separately via `[theme.sidebar]` with a subtly different bg for visual hierarchy
7. Add custom CSS via `st.markdown()` in app.py for: metric card borders, hover effects on buttons, consistent border-radius

**Acceptance:** Theme looks professional with clear visual hierarchy. Profit/loss colors are muted but distinguishable. Charts use consistent palette. Accessible contrast ratio >= 4.5:1.

title: [UI/UX] Implement progressive disclosure on Backtest Launch page
description:
Backtest Launch page (644 LOC) shows ALL configuration at once: strategy selector, symbols, dates, sweep params, overfitting filters, sizing/risk configs, latency model, run buttons, active jobs, recent runs. This causes information overload and cognitive fatigue.

**Changes — Progressive Disclosure Pattern:**
1. **Step 1 (always visible):** Strategy selector + symbols + timeframe + date range + Run buttons
2. **Step 2 (expandable section, collapsed by default):** Parameter sweep configuration — only show if strategy has sweep params
3. **Step 3 (expandable section, collapsed by default):** Advanced options — overfitting filters, sizing/risk configs, latency model
4. Move Active Jobs to a separate tab or sidebar section (they're monitoring, not configuration)
5. Recent Runs should be in a separate 'History' tab within the page
6. Use `st.tabs(['Configure', 'Active Jobs', 'History'])` to separate concerns
7. Show a summary card above the Run button: selected strategy name, X symbols, date range, N combinations

**Acceptance:** User can launch a basic backtest in 3 clicks (select strategy, keep defaults, click Run). Advanced users can expand sections. No functionality removed.

title: [UI/UX] Add meaningful empty states across all dashboard pages
description:
Currently, empty states show generic `st.info('No X found')` messages with no guidance. Research shows empty states are critical onboarding touchpoints.

**Pages needing empty states:**
1. **Strategy Management** — 'No strategies found': Add illustration/icon + 'Create your first strategy to start backtesting' + 'New Strategy' CTA button + optional link to DSL docs
2. **Backtest Launch** — 'No active strategies': Guide to Strategy Management page
3. **Results Analysis** — 'No backtest results yet': Guide to Backtest Launch
4. **Paper Trading** — 'No validated strategies': Explain the workflow (backtest -> validate -> paper trade)
5. **Data Management** — 'No data ingested': Show quick-start for data ingestion with recommended symbols
6. **Discovery** — 'No discovery jobs': Explain what genetic discovery does and how to configure
7. **Settings** — 'No configs': Pre-populate with sensible defaults or one-click template creation

**Pattern:** Each empty state should have: (1) descriptive title, (2) brief explanation, (3) clear CTA action, (4) optional workflow context.

**Acceptance:** Every page handles the zero-data case gracefully with actionable guidance. New users can navigate the workflow without external docs.

title: [UI/UX] Simplify Strategy Management with card-based layout and inline preview
description:
Strategy list uses `st.expander()` with dense text metadata inside. Each expander has inline Edit/Delete/Activate buttons stacked vertically. This makes scanning strategies slow.

**Changes:**
1. Replace expanders with card-based layout using `st.container()` with custom CSS borders
2. Each card shows: name (bold, large), description (truncated to 1 line), timeframe badge, indicator count badge, version badge — all on ONE line
3. Action buttons (Edit, Delete, Activate) in a horizontal row at card bottom, using `st.columns([1,1,1,3])` for proper spacing
4. Add a strategy preview panel: when hovering/clicking a strategy, show a detail sidebar or modal with full DSL YAML, entry/exit conditions, sweep params
5. Strategy editor: simplify the form editor (currently 200+ lines of fields) by grouping into collapsible sections: Basic Info | Indicators | Conditions | Risk Settings | Sweep
6. Form editor should show only relevant fields based on selected type (e.g., ATR fields only when ATR stop loss selected)
7. Add a 'Duplicate Strategy' button for quick iteration

**Acceptance:** Strategy list is scannable at a glance. Cards show key info without expanding. Editor is less overwhelming with logical grouping.

title: [UI/UX] Add dashboard home/overview page with workflow guidance
description:
Currently the app opens directly to Strategy Management. There's no overview or workflow guidance. New users don't know where to start.

**Changes:**
1. Add a new 'Overview' page as the default landing page
2. Show a **workflow pipeline visualization**: Data Ingestion -> Strategy Creation -> Screening -> Validation -> Paper Trading
3. Each step shows current status: number of items (e.g., '3 strategies', '5 completed backtests', '0 paper sessions')
4. Quick-action cards for each step with status indicators (not started / in progress / has results)
5. Show system health at a glance: data coverage summary, active jobs count, last ingestion date
6. Add a 'Getting Started' section for first-time users (collapsible, remembers dismiss state)
7. Show recent activity feed: last 5 actions across all pages (strategy created, backtest completed, etc.)

**Acceptance:** New users immediately understand the workflow. Experienced users get a quick status overview. All functionality links to relevant pages.

title: [UI/UX] Improve Results Analysis page with better data hierarchy and KPI cards
description:
Results Analysis (670 LOC) is the most information-dense page: metrics panel (12 KPIs in 4x3 grid), cost breakdown (3 cols), overfitting results (4 cols), equity curve, drawdown chart, monthly heatmap, P&L histogram, trade log with filters, CSV export. All shown at once.

**Changes:**
1. **Top KPI bar:** Show only the 4 most important metrics prominently: Total Return, Sharpe Ratio, Max Drawdown, Win Rate — using large `st.metric()` cards with color-coded deltas
2. **Secondary metrics:** Group remaining 8 metrics in a collapsible 'Detailed Metrics' section
3. **Chart tabs:** Use `st.tabs(['Equity & Drawdown', 'Monthly Returns', 'Trade Distribution', 'Trade Log'])` instead of stacking all charts vertically
4. **Equity + Drawdown combined:** Show drawdown as a subplot below equity curve (Plotly subplots) rather than separate charts — this is standard in trading platforms
5. **Overfitting results:** Show as pass/fail badges inline with the top KPI bar, not a separate 4-column section. Use `st.badge()` with green/red
6. **Sweep results table:** Add column highlighting for Pareto-optimal rows. Use conditional formatting (green for good Sharpe, red for bad drawdown)
7. **Compare tab:** Add equity curve overlay chart for compared runs, not just a metrics table

**Acceptance:** Key performance visible in <2 seconds. Charts organized in tabs. No vertical scrolling to find trade log.

title: [UI/UX] Add loading states and progress feedback for long operations
description:
Several operations take significant time but have poor feedback: data ingestion shows streaming output (good), but backtest launches show nothing until completion. Discovery page has a progress bar but no ETA.

**Changes:**
1. **Backtest launch:** After clicking Run, show a `st.status()` container with: 'Initializing backtest...', 'Loading data...', 'Running parameter sweep (X/Y combinations)...'
2. **Auto-refresh for active jobs:** Use `st.fragment` with `run_every=5` (5-second auto-refresh) for the active jobs section instead of manual 'Refresh Jobs' button
3. **Discovery page:** Add ETA estimation based on generation time so far (current_gen / total_gens * avg_gen_time)
4. **Data management:** Show per-symbol progress during ingestion (e.g., 'Downloading BTCUSDT... 3/12 months')
5. **Results loading:** Add `st.spinner()` or skeleton placeholder while loading large result sets
6. **Strategy validation:** Show inline validation progress for complex DSL (currently just blocks until done)
7. Use `st.toast()` for quick success notifications instead of `st.success()` which takes up layout space

**Acceptance:** Every operation >1s has visible progress feedback. Active jobs auto-refresh. No manual polling required.

title: [UI/UX] Improve Data Management page with tabbed layout and visual data coverage
description:
Data Management (700 LOC, largest page) shows everything at once: storage metrics, coverage table, ingest form, update/rebuild buttons, download preview, OHLCV browser with candlestick chart, data table, download history, quality verification.

**Changes:**
1. **Tab structure:** `st.tabs(['Data Coverage', 'Ingest & Update', 'Browse Data', 'Quality Check'])` to separate concerns
2. **Data Coverage tab:** 
   - Replace plain table with a visual timeline/heatmap showing data availability per symbol per month (green = available, gray = missing)
   - Storage metrics remain at top as KPI cards
   - Add 'Freshness' indicator: how old is the newest data point per symbol
3. **Ingest & Update tab:** Consolidate ingest + update + rebuild into one coherent flow
   - Show what's available vs what needs downloading before starting
   - Single 'Sync Data' button that intelligently chooses ingest vs update
4. **Browse Data tab:** Keep the candlestick chart + table as-is (already good)
5. **Quality Check tab:** Move verification here with clearer pass/fail summary
6. **Download History:** Move to a collapsible section within Ingest tab (audit log, not primary content)

**Acceptance:** Each tab has a focused purpose. Data coverage is visually scannable. Ingestion flow is simplified.

title: [UI/UX] Add custom CSS for professional card layouts, metric styling, and micro-interactions
description:
Dashboard currently uses default Streamlit styling with no custom CSS. It looks 'obviously Streamlit'. Professional trading dashboards have refined visual polish.

**Changes:**
1. Create `vibe_quant/dashboard/styles.py` with a `inject_custom_css()` function called from `app.py`
2. **Metric cards:** Add subtle border, slight background tint, rounded corners to `st.metric()` containers
3. **Button styling:** Primary buttons get a subtle glow/shadow on hover. Danger buttons (Kill, Delete) get red tint
4. **Status badges:** Replace inline markdown coloring (`:green[text]`) with proper `st.badge()` where available, falling back to styled HTML spans
5. **Table styling:** Add alternating row colors for `st.dataframe()`. Highlight header row
6. **Sidebar refinement:** Add logo/branding area at top. Section separators between nav groups
7. **Container cards:** Use CSS to style `st.container()` elements with subtle borders and shadows for visual grouping
8. **Transitions:** Add subtle CSS transitions for expander open/close and button hover states
9. **Typography:** Use `font = 'sans serif'` in config and ensure consistent heading hierarchy (h1 for page titles, h2 for sections, h3 for subsections)

**Acceptance:** Dashboard looks polished and professional. Visual hierarchy is clear. Interactive elements have feedback. No functionality changes.

title: [UI/UX] Improve Paper Trading page with real-time layout and clearer status hierarchy
description:
Paper Trading page (622 LOC) uses a 2:1 column layout with P&L/positions on left and status/controls on right. Controls are in the sidebar. The layout mixes configuration (start session) with monitoring (live data).

**Changes:**
1. **Separate Start vs Monitor:** Use `st.tabs(['Monitor', 'Start New Session'])` — Monitor is default when a session exists, Start is default when none exists
2. **Monitor tab redesign:**
   - Top bar: large P&L metric + daily change + status badge (full width)
   - Below: 3-column layout for Balance | Margin | Available
   - Positions table: add color-coded P&L column (green/red), add sparkline trend if possible
   - Controls: move HALT/RESUME/CLOSE ALL to a prominent action bar above positions (not buried in sidebar)
3. **Status hierarchy:** Make the trading status (running/halted/error) the most prominent element — use a full-width colored banner: green for running, yellow for paused, red for error
4. **Checkpoint timeline:** Convert from text list to a visual mini-timeline with dots and connecting lines
5. **Move Trader ID** from sidebar to the Monitor tab header
6. **Auto-refresh:** Use `st.fragment` with `run_every=3` for position/P&L updates

**Acceptance:** Critical trading status visible instantly. Controls accessible without scrolling. P&L updates automatically.

title: [UI/UX] Streamline Settings page and add configuration templates
description:
Settings page (517 LOC) has 5 tabs with complex forms for position sizing, risk management, latency presets, database config, and system info. Creating configs requires understanding financial concepts.

**Changes:**
1. **Templates:** Add pre-built configuration templates:
   - Position Sizing: 'Conservative' (0.5% risk), 'Moderate' (1% risk), 'Aggressive' (2% risk)
   - Risk Management: 'Standard' (15% max DD, 2% daily loss), 'Tight' (10% DD, 1% daily), 'Loose' (25% DD, 5% daily)
   - One-click 'Use Template' button that pre-fills the form
2. **Config cards:** Show existing configs as summary cards, not raw parameter dumps
3. **Visual parameter sliders:** Replace number_input for percentages with sliders showing visual range (e.g., risk_per_trade slider 0-5% with colored zones: green=conservative, yellow=moderate, red=aggressive)
4. **Move System Info** to a page footer or app.py sidebar bottom (it's rarely needed)
5. **Database config:** Hide behind an 'Advanced' expander (most users never change this)
6. **Latency presets:** Add a visual diagram showing what co-located vs retail latency means (simple SVG or markdown diagram)
7. **Help text:** Add brief tooltips explaining each parameter in plain English (e.g., 'max_drawdown_pct: The maximum portfolio decline before trading halts')

**Acceptance:** New user can set up sizing + risk config in <1 minute using templates. Parameters have clear explanations.

title: [UI/UX] Improve Discovery page with better visualization and result management
description:
Discovery page (547 LOC) has a dense configuration section (7+ parameters), fitness evolution chart, results table, and job management. The config section is especially overwhelming.

**Changes:**
1. **Preset configurations:** Add 'Quick', 'Standard', 'Deep' discovery presets that set population/generations/mutation defaults
2. **Config layout:** Group parameters into 'Search Space' (population, generations, mutation, elite) and 'Data Range' (symbols, timeframe, dates) using 2-column layout
3. **Fitness chart improvements:**
   - Add shaded area between best and worst fitness (confidence band)
   - Show convergence detection point as a vertical annotation line
   - Add a mini-chart in each result row showing that strategy's fitness evolution
4. **Result cards:** Replace the table with expandable cards showing: rank badge, key metrics (Sharpe, MaxDD, PF), and a mini equity curve preview
5. **Available indicators section:** Currently a dense collapsed list. Convert to a tagged chip/badge layout with category grouping
6. **Export flow:** After 'Export to Strategy', show a success toast with link to Strategy Management page

**Acceptance:** Discovery configuration takes <30s with presets. Results are visually scannable. Export flow is smooth.

title: [UI/UX] Add consistent navigation breadcrumbs and cross-page links
description:
Currently each page is isolated — there's no sense of where you are in the workflow or how pages relate. The only navigation is the sidebar.

**Changes:**
1. Add a workflow breadcrumb/progress bar at the top of relevant pages showing: Data -> Strategies -> Screening -> Validation -> Paper Trading
2. Highlight the current step and show completed steps with checkmarks
3. Add 'Next Step' suggestions at the bottom of each page (e.g., after creating a strategy, suggest 'Launch a Backtest')
4. Add cross-page links in context: Results Analysis should link to the strategy that produced the result. Paper Trading should link to the validation run that qualified it
5. Use `st.page_link()` for navigation between related pages
6. Add a mini status indicator in the sidebar nav showing counts (e.g., 'Strategies (3)', 'Active Jobs (1)')

**Acceptance:** User always knows where they are in the workflow. Relevant cross-page navigation is one click away.

title: [UI/UX] Add keyboard shortcuts and power-user features
description:
Dashboard is entirely mouse-driven. Trading professionals expect keyboard efficiency.

**Changes:**
1. Add keyboard shortcut hints in button tooltips (e.g., 'Run Screening (Ctrl+Enter)')
2. Implement basic keyboard shortcuts using `streamlit-shortcuts` or custom JS injection:
   - Ctrl+N: New strategy
   - Ctrl+Enter: Run/submit current form
   - Ctrl+R: Refresh data
   - Escape: Cancel/close editor
3. Add a command palette (Ctrl+K) for quick navigation between pages and common actions
4. Add 'Quick Actions' dropdown in the header: recent strategies, recent runs, quick backtest launch
5. Support bulk operations where applicable: select multiple strategies for comparison, bulk delete runs

**Acceptance:** Power users can navigate and execute common actions faster. Shortcuts are discoverable via tooltips.

title: [UI/UX] Add responsive layout support and mobile-friendly adaptations
description:
Dashboard uses `layout='wide'` which breaks on tablets and mobile. Column layouts (5-col for job lists) become unreadable on small screens.

**Changes:**
1. Add CSS media queries in custom styles for breakpoints: mobile (<768px), tablet (768-1024px), desktop (>1024px)
2. **Mobile:** Collapse multi-column layouts to single column. Stack metric cards vertically. Hide low-priority columns in tables
3. **Tablet:** Use 2-column max layout. Collapsible sidebar
4. **Tables:** Replace 5-column job layouts with card-based layouts on small screens
5. **Charts:** Ensure Plotly charts have `responsive=True` and reasonable minimum heights
6. **Touch targets:** Ensure buttons have minimum 44x44px touch target size for mobile
7. **Font sizes:** Use relative units (rem) in custom CSS, not fixed px values

**Acceptance:** Dashboard is usable on tablet (iPad). Mobile shows a reasonable read-only view. No horizontal scrolling.

title: Config: quality gates (ruff, mypy) not currently passing
description: pyproject.toml toolchain: ruff has ~30 errors, mypy has ~42 errors. CI enforcement would block all PRs. Fix: introduce blocking-runtime and style-debt CI tracks. See reviews/project_config.md H-1
close_reason: CI/CD configuration task, not a code bug. Quality gates are separate from code review issues.

title: Purged K-Fold: indicator_lookback_bars not auto-detected from DSL

title: Show overfitting risk indicator during strategy creation
description: Currently overfitting risk (Low/Medium/High) only appears on backtest launch page. Add it to the validation summary in strategy editor so users see '⚠ HIGH overfitting risk (500 combos)' while they're still building the strategy, not after.

title: Risk Parameter Panel - conditional fields with live risk/reward visualization
description:
Current: Stop-loss and take-profit show ALL parameter fields simultaneously regardless of selected type. No visual feedback on risk/reward ratio.

Problem: TradingView and MetaTrader Position Sizer show risk parameters updating in real-time. Current form shows irrelevant fields (e.g., ATR multiplier when fixed_pct is selected).

Acceptance Criteria:
- Conditional field visibility based on selected type:
  - fixed_pct: show percent field only
  - atr_fixed: show ATR multiplier + indicator dropdown (pre-populated from defined ATR indicators)
  - atr_trailing: show ATR multiplier + indicator dropdown
  - risk_reward: show ratio slider only
- Live risk/reward visualization:
  - Simple bar chart showing entry -> SL distance vs entry -> TP distance
  - R:R ratio displayed as a metric card
  - Warning colors when ratio < 1.0
- Indicator auto-detection: if ATR indicator defined, auto-populate SL/TP indicator field
- Quick presets: Conservative (1% SL, 2:1 RR), Moderate (2% SL, 1.5:1 RR), Aggressive (3% SL, 1:1 RR)
- ATR indicator dropdown only shows indicators of type ATR (filter from defined indicators)

Files to modify:
- vibe_quant/dashboard/pages/strategy_management.py (stop_loss and take_profit form sections)

Priority: P2 (Medium). Competitive edge over NinjaTrader, QuantConnect, Backtrader (all lack live risk feedback).

title: Playwright E2E test suite: 6 critical workflow tests, CI integration
Add result notes/annotations field to backtest_results
description: Add a notes/annotations text field to the backtest_results table so users can record observations about specific backtest runs. Add an editable text area in the dashboard results view. This helps with research tracking and decision-making. Files: vibe_quant/db/schema.py, vibe_quant/db/state_manager.py, vibe_quant/dashboard/pages/results_analysis.py.

title: Time Filter Visual Editor - weekly schedule grid with session presets
description:
Current: Blocked days use multiselect. Sessions have no form representation (only in YAML). Funding avoidance is checkbox + two number inputs.

Problem: Time filters are critical for crypto strategies (funding every 8h, weekend behavior differences) but the UI treats them as an afterthought.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Visual weekly schedule: 7-day x 24-hour grid where users can paint allowed/blocked trading windows
- Session quick presets: 'Asia session' (00:00-08:00 UTC), 'London session' (08:00-16:00 UTC), 'US session' (13:00-21:00 UTC), '24/7'
- Funding time overlay: show 8h funding schedule on grid with avoidance buffer zones visualized
- Time zone selector with live clock showing 'current exchange time'
- Move time filters to a dedicated collapsible section with clear label and icon
- Interactive: click to toggle hours, drag to select ranges
- Export to session config YAML format

Files to modify:
- vibe_quant/dashboard/pages/strategy_management.py (time filter section)
- New: vibe_quant/dashboard/components/time_filter_editor.py

Priority: P3 (Low). High effort, lower relative impact. Nice-to-have for visual polish.

title: WFA uses >= instead of > for threshold comparisons (off-by-one)
Extract shared PerformanceMetrics dataclass
description:
## Problem
Screening and validation pipelines define overlapping metric fields independently:
- `screening/pipeline.py` defines `BacktestMetrics` dataclass with: sharpe, sortino, max_drawdown, total_return, profit_factor, win_rate, num_trades, fees, funding
- `validation/runner.py` defines `ValidationResult` dataclass with the same fields plus extras

This duplication causes:
- Inconsistent field names/types between modules
- Dashboard code that must handle both formats
- Risk of metric definition drift

## Solution
Create `vibe_quant/metrics.py` with a shared `PerformanceMetrics` dataclass containing the common fields. Both `BacktestMetrics` and `ValidationResult` should compose or extend this class.

```python
@dataclass
class PerformanceMetrics:
    sharpe_ratio: float
    sortino_ratio: float
    max_drawdown_pct: float
    total_return_pct: float
    profit_factor: float
    win_rate: float
    num_trades: int
    total_fees: float
    total_funding: float
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] `vibe_quant/metrics.py` created with `PerformanceMetrics`
- [ ] `screening/pipeline.py` `BacktestMetrics` uses/extends `PerformanceMetrics`
- [ ] `validation/runner.py` `ValidationResult` uses/extends `PerformanceMetrics`
- [ ] Dashboard pages that read metrics work with unified type
- [ ] All existing tests pass

## Files to Modify
- NEW: vibe_quant/metrics.py
- vibe_quant/screening/pipeline.py
- vibe_quant/validation/runner.py
- vibe_quant/dashboard/pages/results_analysis.py (if it accesses metric fields)

title: Compute and display cost drag % and expectancy metrics
description: Two key derived metrics are missing from the dashboard: (1) Cost Drag % = (total_fees + total_funding + total_slippage) / gross_pnl * 100 — shows how much of the edge is consumed by transaction costs. (2) Expectancy = (win_rate * avg_win) + ((1 - win_rate) * avg_loss) — expected dollar value per trade. Also add Payoff Ratio = abs(avg_win / avg_loss). These are critical for evaluating strategy viability at scale. Files: vibe_quant/dashboard/pages/results_analysis.py.

title: Add trade scatter plot (ROI vs duration) colored by direction
description: Add a scatter plot with X=trade duration (hours), Y=ROI%, colored by direction (long=green, short=red). This reveals whether the strategy holds losers too long, cuts winners too short, or has different holding patterns for longs vs shorts. Size dots by position notional value. Trade data already has entry_time, exit_time, roi_pct, and direction fields. Files: vibe_quant/dashboard/pages/results_analysis.py.
